entry.title: Keystone Species
entry.summary:
Author: SpaceflowerGrace

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 62,938Chapters: 10/12Kudos: 132

Summary: They didn't talk much about why Stiles was back in town. His mother had been inordinately proud of that fact she went into labor and delivered Stiles alone in the woods. It was the eighties, she couldn’t exactly call her husband on her cell phone. Stiles was born healthy in the preserve. Scott got hurt. Scott is Stiles to protect. He always has been. Stiles is pissed about quite a few things. “Scott is my fifteen year old cousin! And you hurt him and then left him alone and hurt? What’s wrong with you?” He has gotten very close to Derek’s face. Stiles takes a breath and turns away. Or- what if Stiles was the responsible adult at home?

entry.title: Derek's Person
entry.summary:
Author: ash_mcj

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,092Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 2,914

Summary: Derek didn’t like people—they set him on edge in a way that nobody quite seemed to understand, much to his vexation. They always invited themselves into his space, like they somehow had a right to be there. They touched his clothes, his books, his skin—leaving their scents clinging to things that were supposed to smell like himself. They expected him to talk to them, and never managed to wrap their heads around the notion that he just couldn’t. Words were difficult for him to use most of the time, and despite all efforts to communicate in other ways, people just didn’t understand. But it didn’t matter anyway, because Derek didn’t like people and had no inclination to socialize with them.But Stiles was…different, somehow. He did everything that Derek hated, and more. He intruded into Derek’s space, he rambled constantly, loudly, with flailing arms and fidgeting fingers—and his presence should have driven Derek up the wall, but it didn’t. Stiles didn’t set him on edge, like everyone else did. And maybe most surprising of all, he understood him.[or: reclusive, feral-risk derek hale finds solace in a wild child, much to his pack’s surprise](previously titled "Stiles Stilinski")

entry.title: the shape of being chosen
entry.summary:
Author: sourwolf97

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,762Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 17

Summary: Derek huffs, the softest hesitation of a laugh, warm against his skin. “You talk in your sleep,” he counters quietly. “A lot.” Panic flickers up his spine before Stiles can stop it. He forces his voice to stay light, easy. “It’s probably just my soul trying to escape my body,” he says. “Can’t blame it, really.” But inside, he’s scrolling through mental footage of every night he’s ever crashed here, cataloguing every murky, half-remembered dream, wondering what words might have slipped out when his guard was down. Did he say Derek’s name? Did he say I love you? Did he say don’t leave? Did he confess the whole pathetic thesis statement his brain has been footnoting for months now: I know this isn’t actually anything for you, and that’s fine, I’m fine, please just let me keep pretending until you get bored?

entry.title: the shape of your ghost in the doorway
entry.summary:
Author: Joy_peace

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,979Chapters: 7/7Kudos: 2

Summary: The rain had been falling since dawn, thin needles tapping on the Hale loft windows like they were trying to burrow their way in. Beacon Hills existed in a perpetual state of damp unease these days—something like grief, but heavier. Something like a space in the world where someone used to stand. Someone named Theo Raeken. Five months. Five months of steady rain. Liam Dunbar stood in the wide, half-empty living room of the loft, arms crossed tightly against his chest even though he didn’t feel cold. He hadn’t felt much of anything in weeks. His pack—Scott’s pack, though Scott insisted it was Liam’s too now that everyone was older—moved around him in a quiet bustle of research. Pages turned. Phones vibrated. Arguments rose and fell like waves. (Inspired by Taylor Swift’s “My Tears Ricochet” and “The Archer”)

entry.title: Curiosity Killed The Cat
entry.summary:
Author: EverythingRara

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,829Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 63

Summary: He could still feel the thick press of Derek’s cock through soft fabric, the hard line of his knot, how it had throbbed in Stiles’ hand when he squeezed. Derek had been panting, whining against his cheek, the sounds embedding themselves in Stiles’ mind like a mantra, circling back over and over. Derek had warned him that his curiosity would get him into trouble. How right he’d been. Because now Stiles had gotten a taste—just a taste—and the hunger to know more gnawed at him. He wanted to see it properly, feel it, skin to skin. He wanted to taste it, run his tongue along that hard ridge and discover the weight of it on his tongue. His mouth watered, his stomach tightened at the thought. Could he take it? Not just in his mouth—but deeper. He imagined himself being the hole Derek pushed into, the one Derek knotted into, holding him tight. The image made his legs weak. And that’s what led to now: Stiles standing in Derek’s loft, fingers twitching as he tried to organize his thoughts. His tongue felt thick, his mouth dry, and every word seemed impossible. A nervous laugh bubbled out before he could stop it. Stiles clapped a hand over his mouth, but it was too late.

entry.title: Brutal
entry.summary:
Author: arthurvittal

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 37,091Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 8

Summary: Amidst the forest bathed in the unparalleled light of the full moon, rain, blood, and mud intertwine with the fate of Stiles Stilinski, a young man on the brink of collapse between the genuine love of Derek Hale and the murderous violence of his ex, Theo Raeken.In the wake of pain, transformation, and buried secrets, Theo awakens to something he doesn't yet understand, but which consumes him from the inside out. Rage, instinct, memory, and fear drag him deeper into his obsession—which, in truth, had never left his mind.Meanwhile, Derek and Stiles try to resume a daily life that seems only possible through sarcasm, sharp jokes, and stolen kisses. But, unfortunately, Beacon Hills never forgets. And behind the tenderness lie wounds too deep, unconfessed sins, and a threat that breathes hungrily behind its shadows.This is an intense, overwhelming, and resilient novel. Where we talk about love in times of total darkness, about monsters that live inside and outside the skin, and about what remains of us when we are forced to survive, between brutality and kindness.

entry.title: A Tether in the Dark
entry.summary:
Author: ReadNowSleepLater

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 27,511Chapters: 22/?Kudos: 98

Summary: Stiles Stilinski never meant to become a myth. After the fall of his pack and the fading of Beacon Hills’ magic, he runs – straight into a world older, darker, and far more complicated than he ever imagined. Mystic Falls is supposed to be a quiet place to start over, to ground himself again. Instead, it becomes the center of a storm he didn’t know was waiting for him. Drawn into the tangled lives of the Mikaelsons, Stiles finds unexpected warmth among immortals who should’ve terrified him – and something dangerously close to belonging. Between Elijah’s steady grace, Kol’s mischief, Klaus’ possessive charm, and Peter’s return from the shadows, he starts to build something new: a family stitched together by chaos, magic, and a kind of love that defies logic. But magic never lets go without a fight, and neither do old bonds. When ghosts from his past and creatures from the dark rise to claim him, Stiles has to face what it truly means to be an anchor – and what, and who, he’s willing to tether himself to. Because in the end, even in the dark, someone always reaches back.

Author: ProLuna

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 35,444Chapters: 22/42Kudos: 67

Summary: Stiles is a new novice at the Beacon Hills Temple of the Moon Goddess, where the priests have forsworn all women and have ritual sex to make seminal offerings to their deity. In an AU where a moon cult is the dominant religion in an alternate fantasy-type world, Stiles navigates friendship, love, and a confusing priesthood that has way too many rules about sex for basically being Sex University.A lot of other pairings along the way, but from the beginning, this story is about how we get to Sterek.

entry.title: You’re Safe, I’m Here
entry.summary:
Author: Joy_peace

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 12,060Chapters: 9/?Kudos: 15

Summary: The Beacon Hills Preserve had always been quiet in the early evenings, the kind of quiet that hummed in the bones of anyone supernatural. Most people would call it peaceful. Liam Dunbar called it suspicious. He walked a few steps ahead, his eyes flicking between the trees, inhaling like he expected to catch a threat in the damp leaves or the wind. His shoulders were coiled tight—too tight for a patrol that was supposed to be routine. The sun hovered low enough to stain the whole forest with orange and copper. Behind him, Theo Raeken let out a slow, theatrical sigh. “Dunbar,” he said, voice low but full of a patience he very smugly claimed he didn’t have, “you’re clenching your jaw so hard I can hear your molars trying to fuse.”

entry.title: I Wanna Be Yours
entry.summary:
Author: Taintedtricked

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,598Chapters: 5/6Kudos: 45

Summary: Stiles never meant to fall for Derek Hale — the brooding, half-feral werewolf who grunts more than he talks and looks at him like he’s both a headache and a heartbeat. But somewhere between burnt coffee, pack crises, and late nights spent patching each other up, Stiles realizes he doesn’t just want to be in Derek’s orbit — he wants to be his. Derek’s spent his life building walls so no one can get close enough to hurt him again. But Stiles is persistent, sunlight in human form, and Derek’s starting to wonder if maybe it’s okay to want warmth. Secrets held too long begin to unravel, and somewhere between the noise and the silence, they find it — the quiet truth neither of them can ignore. “Maybe I just wanna be yours.” A slow-burn Sterek story inspired by I Wanna Be Yours by Arctic Monkeys — all coffee, comfort, and confessions you never meant to say out loud.
